paths: Patient with Abdominal Discomfort with Altered Bowel Motility -> Rome diagnostic criteria for IBS (Table 1) -> Positive result -> Perform physical examination -> IBS subtype -> Directed diagnostic testing, if necessary -> Diarrhea -> Loperamide Diphenoxylate -> Alosetron

Patient with Abdominal Discomfort with Altered Bowel Motility -> Rome diagnostic criteria for IBS (Table 1) -> Negative result -> Consider other functional GI disorders -> See Chronic Diarrhea (p 204) and Constipation (p 208)
